adjective.description: Coming at the end of a series.
examples: the final version of the report was presented

noun.description: The last game in a sports tournament or other competition, which decides the winner of the tournament.
A series of examinations at the end of a degree course.
examples: she was doing her history finals

noun.description: The principal note in a mode.
The final approach of a landing aircraft to a runway.
examples: the plane piloted by Richards was on finals

origin: Middle English (in the adjectival sense conclusive): from Old French, or from Latin finalis, from finis end. Compare with finish.
